articles.title: Lydia Gabriela Speyer
articles.description: Postdoctoral Research Associate, University of Cambridge
articles.contents:

Lydia Gabriela Speyer




About Me
Contact



About Me
My research focuses on the development of co-occurring mental health
problems during childhood and adolescence. I’m also interested in
quantitative methodology, particularly in relation to using longitudinal
data analysis methods to enhance substantative reserach.
Currently, I am working at the Blakemore
Lab to work on the Cambridge
Mind App (CaM-App) study which investigates the mental health
trajectories of adolescents and adults around the globe during the
ongoing COVID-19 pandemic using an innovative smartphone app. The
CaM-App study collects data on mental health, as well as phone-based
data such as app usage, movement and sleeping data to gain comprehensive
insights into which behaviours might exacerbate or mitigate the negative
effects of loneliness during social-distancing.
Before joining the Universtiy of Cambridge, I completed my PhD in
Psychology at the University of Edinburgh focusing on Co-occurring
Mental Health Problems across Childhood and Adolescence: Within-Person
Developmental Relations, Mediators and Antecedents.


Contact
\(@\)LydiaSpeyer
ls945@cam.ac.uk
Google
